definition: the law/the law of the land/the law of a state (in former times)/criterion
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
surname Wang
to rule/to reign over
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: Such is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who depend on him.
sentences.chinese: 埃及王法老向一切倚靠他的人也是這樣。

sentences.english: And Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh king of Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 約瑟見埃及王法老的時候年三十歲。

sentences.english: Go in， speak unto Pharaoh king of Egypt， that he let the children of Israel go out of his land.
sentences.chinese: 你進去對埃及王法老說，要容以色列人出他的地。

sentences.english: Joseph was thirty years old when he entered the service of Pharaoh king of Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 約瑟見埃及王法老的時候年三十歲。

sentences.english: While Josiah was king, Pharaoh Neco king of Egypt went up to the Euphrates River to help the king of Assyria.
sentences.chinese: 約西亞年間，埃及王法老尼哥上到伯拉河攻擊亞述王。

sentences.english: The Pharaoh or king of Egypt would not let Moses take God's people back to the promised land.
sentences.chinese: 埃及王法老不肯容摩西帶領神的百姓迴應許之地。

sentences.english: Go, tell Pharaoh king of Egypt to let the Israelites go out of his country.
sentences.chinese: 你進去對埃及王法老說，要容以色列人出他的地。

sentences.english: One night, Pharaoh, king of Eqypt, dreamt about seven fat cows.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上，埃及王法老夢見七隻肥牛。

sentences.english: The imperial laws forbade the ordinary people to wear yellow.
sentences.chinese: 古代的王法禁止普通人穿黃色的衣服。

sentences.english: And his miracles， and his acts， which he did in the midst of Egypt unto Pharaoh the king of Egypt， and unto all his land；
sentences.chinese: 並他在埃及中向埃及王法老和其全地所行的神蹟奇事。

sentences.english: the signs he performed and the things he did in the heart of Egypt, both to Pharaoh king of Egypt and to his whole country;
sentences.chinese: 並他在埃及中向埃及王法老和其全地所行的神蹟奇事。

definition: national law
to have disregard for human life (idiom)
Heaven's law/the natural order of things
with no regard for law or discipline (idiom); flouting the law and disregarding all rules/in complete disorder
to circumvent the law
a law
to break the law
regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
to disrespect one's superiors/to offend one's elders
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to rebel against the emperor (idiom)
law and order/rules and discipline
how can this be so? (idiom); preposterous/ridiculous/absurd
the rules and discipline that apply within a family/stick used for punishing children or servants/traditions of an artistic or academic school of thought, passed on from master to pupil
to know the law and break it (idiom); consciously going against the rules
mortal crime/capital offense
